summary_markdown: This data presents a comparative analysis of different product categories, detailing brand performance within each. For Analgesics, Tesco leads with a 22% purchase rate and 37% loyal buyers, followed by Nurofen, Boots, and Panadol. In Deodorants, Lynx has the highest purchase rate at 17% and 21% loyalty, with Dove, Tesco, and Nivea trailing. Crisps (potato chips) are dominated by Walkers, holding a 68% purchase rate and 37% loyalty, significantly ahead of KP and Kettle Foods. Breakfast cereals show Kelloggs as the market leader with 29% purchase rate and 7% loyalty, followed by Cereal Partners and Weet-Bix. Yoghurts are led by Muller at 24% purchase rate and 7% loyalty, with Muller Light, Ski, and Danone also listed. An overall average across all categories indicates a 13% market share and 13% buyer loyalty.
